tweets.text:
Thread‚Äîresponses to @vgr challenge: opinions on relaxation and fun. 

Well played, Venkatesh, I think I may suck at this.

1/ Relaxation and fun are good for the soul, but prescribing them as such often backfires. Ì†ΩÌ∏è 

Relaxation is inconsistent with force, and prescriptions that enforce behaviors tend to increase tension rather than ease.
2/ One person‚Äôs R&F is another person‚Äôs ennui and decadence. Keys to the difference include engagement, connection, richness, freshness (not the same as novelty).
3/ Relaxation and fun may or may not coincide. Different flavors of relaxation may be more or less fun and vice versa.

4/ Overexposure to images of R&F as opposed to direct experience distorts one‚Äôs perceptions and impedes engagement. We end up chasing appearances rather that creating/encountering genuine experiences. Cf Instagram
5/ I‚Äôve had substantial experience w/ R&F induced or facilitated by alcohol &/or drugs. It‚Äôs all good except when it stops being good.

6/ As a Very Serious Young Person drugs were a revelation. I reveled in the freedom to flip the seriousness switch OFF. (Hmm. Must look into the etymological relationship between REVEL and REVELATION Is there one? That was a fun thought, but not an especially relaxing one.)
7/ For me, fun has often been a side effect of intellectual labor. I love that. And I‚Äôm aware that a consequence is that sometimes i turn fun into work.

8/ I‚Äôm somewhat bemused at how much I like Twitter. It‚Äôs rarely relaxing, but usually fun. The bemusement, occasionally verging on embarrassment, lies in noticing the shallowness of some of the ‚Äúfun.‚Äù
9/ Shallow non-relaxing Twitter fun = chasing dopamine hits (likes, outrage, affiliation without depth, self-righteousness, distraction).

10/ Richer/deeper (and somewhat relaxing) Twitter fun = genuine moments of appreciation, connection, admiration, curiosity, discovery. 

11/ This started to be fun for me at about #5.

12/ As with all good things, relaxation and fun can bite you. Relaxation can degrade into disengagement. 

Time for a break!
13/ sex for fun and relaxation is a wondrous and non-trivial activity. There should be more of this.

14/ keys to truly relaxing and fun sex:
Ability to laugh at self and partner and to be laughed at
Keen sense of the absurd
Willingness to be surprised 
Generosity 
Stamina can be advantageous
15/ Feeling superior is a highly degraded and degrading form of fun. It‚Äôs rarely relaxing because image management is work. (Ask me how I know.)
16/ Joy is independent of relaxation and fun.

17/ Relaxation and fun occur in inverse proportion to the effort one devoted to chasing them. It‚Äôs a truism that survives direct investigation: the greatest relaxation and fun arise as a side effect of full engagement with the present moment.

18/ this morning it looks to me like some degree of relaxation is essential for genuine fun. If you can‚Äôt allow your mind to relax, it‚Äôs hard to have fun. NB, focus is not inconsistent with relaxation.
19/ snuggles with Princess Catalina = relaxation and fun https://t.co/6seWrbicD0
20/ Monty Python is fun
21/ Live theater is fun https://t.co/u0fxG4QX7W
22/ Chamomile tea is relaxing Ì†ΩÌ∏å
23/ Lowering one‚Äôs standards can be fun and relaxing
24/ Unfollowing Twitter accounts that add more noise than signal is relaxing. (Pro tip: Also an excellent strategy for reducing non-productive righteous indignation)
25/ Wrapping gifts while watching episode 5 of Watchmen is fun and relaxing. https://t.co/4NSQtwbGld

26/ You know what's fun and relaxing? Making a few strategic donations. Two of my faves on here: @SpreadTheVoteUS (voter IDs so everyone who wants to can vote https://t.co/1Q9D976NkP) and 
@humanutility (help folx pay utility bills https://t.co/RWdUq9G37h)
